720773f-a.title: Manhattan: Lafayette Street - Jersey Street
720773f-a.text:
Lafayette Street (Elm Street), north from but not including eersey
Street, showing the street under construction to East Houston Street,
after the demolition of buildings which formerly stood there. The
construction of the street necessitated the razing of many buildings in
a northerly direction from Elm Street, which terminated at a point
slightly south of ersey Street, to Lafayette Place, which commenced at
Great Jones Street. The new thoroughfare was named Lafayette Street several
years later and under it was built the Interborough Rapid Transit Co.
(TI.R.T.) subway.
November 23, 1900.
Board of Transportation Photograph.
william B. Parsons Collection.  neg t S7
720773f-a.folder: Lafayette Street & Jersey Street, Manhattan, NY

720772f-a.title: Manhattan: Lafayette Street - Jersey Street
720772f-a.text:
Lafayette Street, north from Jersey Street.
March 16, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
